captions.text: BEHIND-THE-SCENES: VISUAL AND AUDIO DESIGN
The Dominion map looks fantastic.
It’s by far and away the best map we’ve ever made.
The entire map feels alive; things are moving. All the capture points are totally differentiated from each other.
It’s not mirrored like Summoner’s Rift and Twisted Treeline.
The look and feel is really trying to create this world that’s alive.
A lot of the capture points will have landmarks. And each of those landmarks will be in some way slowly moving or animating.
For instance, some of the lifts in one of the capture points are going to slowly bring up these minerals and crystals,
and you got the Windmill slowly churning with all its gears and the magic driving it.
We’re trying to create kind of a story within a story.
Pretty much create some kind of production line of these crystals being processed and then turned into a usable source of magic.
Here we have the new map and what I’m doing is going through and populating some of these islands you see in here and lighting them.
And you can adjust the intensity, the radius, and slide them around and you get real time lighting anywhere you want to go.
We have a lot of particles that we are going to be placing that add more life too. For instance,
we also have torches and ground fog and things like that; so a lot of things moving around.
The audio team really saw it as a big opportunity to take the music in League of Legends to the next level.
We wanted to keep it in that fantasy vein that really fits, but we want to have an edge to it.
We looked at the map and we kind of thought of elements that we could bring in from the world around
that you would actually hear, and bring it into the music.
So, when the music is playing you’ll actually hear anvil hits and all these different kind of things that really brings the map to life.
We set up an interactive music system so that the music actually responds to the current status of the game.
It reacts to what’s going on between the two teams.
As the teams get closer and closer to victory, the music gets more and more epic and intense
as we kind of build to this final climactic battle.
I think that the first time players hear the music in Dominion they’re going to be incredibly excited
because it’s a whole new, big, epic experience of League of Legends that we haven’t been able to deliver before.
Things look fantastic.  But we also really maintained the style that we love and that our players love.
It’s a massive update.  It’s really innovative.  It’s extremely fun.
It’s very fast paced.
Every strategic capture point is totally different.
The background art in the environment is done at a much higher level than we have done before.
It has a lot of great detail that enhances the experience, but doesn’t detract from the gameplay.
I think our players are going to love it.
CAPTURE
DEFEND
DOMINATE
JOIN THE LEAGUE AT SIGNUP.LEAGUEOFLEGENDS.COM

title: League of Legends: Dominion - Art & Sound Behind the Scenes
